name: Leontopodium
description: Leontopodium is a genus of about 40 species of perennials in the family Asteraceae, native to Europe and Asia. These plants can be found in many challenging environments, usually growing in limestone soil on mountain meadows at altitudes between 1500 and 3000 m.The true flowers are short lived, yellow and tiny, surrounded by white petals that form a star-like formation. They bloom from late spring to early autumn and are easy to care for.
img_urls: https://www.atozflowers.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/05/594px-Leontopodium_fauriei_var._angustifolium_-_細葉雛薄雪草ホソバヒナウスユキソウ_8920130847-150x150.jpg
meaning: The genus name “Leontopodium” comes from the Greek words “leon” (lion) and “podion” (diminutive of pous, foot), meaning “lions paw”. It refers to the shape and woolly aspect of the flower. Edelweiss means “noble white” in German (“edel” means “noble” and “weiss” means “white”).
color_description: This plant has small, yellow clustered florets.
